title: Mandy Moore transforms into an older Rebecca Pearson on the set of This Is Us
text:
She stars on beloved NBC drama This Is Us.

And Mandy Moore gave her followers a glimpse at herself transforming into an older Rebecca Pearson behind-the-scenes via her Instagram Story on Wednesday.

The 35-year-old Emmy nominee sat in a beauty chair while makeup artists went to town on shaping wrinkles and grooves into her otherwise flawless face.

The process: Mandy Moore gave her followers a glimpse at herself transforming into an Rebecca Pearson while behind-the-scenes via her Instagram Story on Wednesday

'Starting age makeup at 4:30 means a laaaaaaaate night,' she captioned one of the videos she Insta-storied for her 3.9M followers.

By the end Moore was hardly recognizable, sporting a grey bob and a turtleneck sweater to compliment her new look.

The next day Moore shared quite the contrast to her elderly look, posting a throwback shot of herself as a child with frizzy hair and braces.

'She means business,' she hilariously captioned the photo that garnered over 30K likes within its first hour of posting.

Wow: By the end Moore was hardly recognizable, sporting a grey bob and a turtleneck sweater to compliment her new look

Her appearance comes a couple of weeks after she released her first single in over ten years entitled When I Wasn't Watching.

She told People of the release on the red carpet at the 2019 Emmy Awards: 'I just "dropped it," as the kids say.'

'I am super excited about it and happy that people have been digging it so far.'

Mandy went on to gush that the response for the song so far has been 'extremely positive.'

Cute: The next day Moore shared quite the contrast to her elderly look, posting a throwback shot of herself as a child with frizzy hair and braces

'I’m so overwhelmed and heartened that people even know or still care that I make music, because I really truly am still doing it selfishly for me,' she said.

'I miss it, I miss writing, I miss performing, I miss the whole thing, so it feels really, really good to be back there.'

She added: 'It’s not a bad deal, I feel incredibly lucky. I am just soaking in every second of this particular moment.'

The Candy hitmaker worked alongside her husband, Dawes frontman Taylor Goldsmith, on the single.

Collaborators: The Candy hitmaker worked alongside her husband, Dawes frontman Taylor Goldsmith, on the single

Goldsmith opened up to People about the experience of collaborating with her.

'It means so much to me because I know it means so much to her,' he said.

'I watch her light up as she gets to express herself again as a songwriter and singer in the way she hasn’t in a long time. It’s so inspiring.'

This Is Us airs Tuesdays at 9 p.m. PT/ET.
